abstract: The British member of Parliament fixed a withering eye on Frederick A. Goodwin, the former chief executive of the Royal Bank of Scotland, now government-owned, and put the question to him: “Do you have a different moral compass from other bankers?” he asked. “Are you an aberration?”
lead_paragraph: The British member of Parliament fixed a withering eye on Frederick A. Goodwin, the former chief executive of the Royal Bank of Scotland, now government-owned, and put the question to him: “Do you have a different moral compass from other bankers?” he asked. “Are you an aberration?”
